title: IBM Cloud® Databases for Elasticsearch docs
introduction: Elasticsearch combines the power of a full text search engine with the indexing strengths of a JSON document database.

section_recommended.title: Getting Started
section_recommended.description: A brief tutorial to introduce using an IBM Cloud® Databases for Elasticsearch deployment.

section_recommended.title: Setting the Admin Password
section_recommended.description: The Databases for Elasticsearch service is provisioned with an admin user. You must set the admin password before you use it to connect.

section_recommended.title: Getting Connection Strings
section_recommended.description: To connect to IBM Cloud® Databases for Elasticsearch, you need some users and connection strings. Connection Strings for your deployment are displayed on the Dashboard Overview, in the Endpoints panel. These strings can be used with any set of credentials that you generate.

tiles.title: Elasticsearch machine learning tutorials documentation published
tiles.description: New tutorials created to highlight the ML features of Elasticsearch. For more information, see Use Elasticsearch vector search capabilities, Use ELSER, Elastic's Natural Language Processing model, and Use machine learning models with Elasticsearch to tag content.

tiles.title: Elasticsearch, machine learning, and AI
tiles.description: Elasticsearch, a robust search-capable database, is well-suited to seamlessly incorporate essential ML features sought by enterprises embracing new technologies.

tiles.title: Monitoring Integration documentation updated
tiles.description: Monitoring Integration documentation now lists metrics for all Cloud Databases services.
